contextId.occurrenceNote: These are two phrases in parallel with each other. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-parallelism]])
contextId.quote: καθαρίσατε χεῖρας, ἁμαρτωλοί, καὶ ἁγνίσατε καρδίας, δίψυχοι.
contextId.glQuote: Cleanse your hands, you sinners, and purify your hearts, you double-minded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is saying the same thing in different ways for emphasis. The abstract nouns "laughter," "sadness," "joy," and "gloom" can be translated as verbs or adjectives. Alternate translation: "Stop laughing and be sad. Stop being joyful and be gloomy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-parallelism]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: ὁ γέλως ὑμῶν εἰς πένθος μετατραπήτω, καὶ ἡ χαρὰ εἰς κατήφειαν.
contextId.glQuote: Let your laughter turn into sadness and your joy into gloom
